author: Bernadette E. Tamayo
title: New law protects caregivers – Estrada | The Manila Times
text:
SEN. Jose "Jinggoy" Estrada on Monday said caregivers can now look forward to better working conditions following the enactment of a law ensuring their rights and welfare.
The senator said Republic Act (RA) 11965 or the "Caregivers' Welfare Act," signed into law on November 23 by President Ferdinand Marcos Jr., assures caregivers benefits and protection against all forms of abuses.
Sen. Jose ‘Jinggoy’ Estrada on the Senate floor. PHOTO BY RENE H. DILAN Sen. Jose 'Jinggoy' Estrada on the Senate floor. PHOTO BY RENE H. DILAN "This is a big step to ensure the promotion of the welfare of our caregivers and give protection to the vulnerable but vigorous sector of our society," Estrada said.
He raised the need to defend the rights of caregivers and ensure their protection against harassment, violence, and economic exploitation.
"It is essential to protect them from any mistreatment. Caregivers are frequently undervalued and should be treated with dignity, respect, and fairness," Estrada said in a statement.

author: 小浪财讯
title: 券商ETF（512000）跌1.74%，半日成交额3.96亿元|券商_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，券商ETF（512000）跌1.74%，报1.017元，成交额3.96亿元。券商ETF（512000）重仓股方面， 中信证券 截止午盘跌1.55%， 东方财富 跌2.19%， 国泰海通 跌0.65%， 华泰证券 跌1.93%， 招商证券 跌1.31%， 东方证券 跌1.89%， 广发证券 跌1.98%， 申万宏源 跌1.45%， 兴业证券 跌1.66%， 中金公司 跌1.91%。
券商ETF（512000）业绩比较基准为 中证全指证券公司指数 ，管理人为华宝基金管理有限公司，基金经理为丰晨成、胡洁，成立（2016-08-30）以来回报为3.45%，近一个月回报为1.42%。

author: ANTHONY IZAGUIRRE
title: New York governor pushes for tax increase after nixing toll program in Manhattan
text: On Wednesday, Gov. Kathy Hochul enraged environmentalists and public transit advocates — but delighted suburban commuters — by putting the brakes on a plan to battle New York City's traffic by imposing high tolls on Manhattan drivers. On Thursday, she was scrambling to get support for her proposal to hike a business tax as a way of replacing the $1 billion per year the tolls had been expected to raise for New York's ailing subway system. The governor's behind-the-scenes effort to get legislative approval for the tax hike came a day after she unexpectedly upended the “congestion pricing” toll, a program that was in the works for years and had been scheduled to launch June 30. The Legislature, which is expected to wrap up its annual legislative session on Friday, would have to approve the tax increase on city businesses, known as a payroll mobility tax. It did not appear to have much support. “To tell New Yorkers that you care about the cost of living and then to propose a raise on their taxes, to me, is incomprehensible. It does not make sense,” said Sen. Zellnor Myrie, a Democrat. Avi Small, a spokesman for Hochul, declined Thursday to provide details on the governor's proposed tax increase and instead referred a reporter to comments Hochul made a day earlier in a pre-recorded video announcing the indefinite pause of congestion pricing. "We have set aside funding to backstop the MTA capital plan, and are currently exploring other funding sources," Hochul said Wednesday, referring to the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, the entity that controls the subway, bus and commuter rail systems that serve the city. Congestion pricing was signed into law by former Gov. Andrew Cuomo in 2019 after years of advocacy from public transit advocates. In her pre-recorded statement, the governor said she was blocking the plan because of its financial burden on residents dealing with inflation and high costs of living. She also cited the city's fragile economic position as it continues to recover from the COVID-19 pandemic. Drivers entering Manhattan south of 60th Street would have had to pay tolls of around $15, depending on vehicle type, on top of tolls for entering the same area via certain bridges and tunnels. Sen. Liz Krueger, a Democrat who chairs a legislative finance committee, noted that the proposed business tax would eventually be passed down to workers and said she does not think her chamber would support such a proposal. “Remember, payroll mobility taxes are actually taxes on the workers. It's not a corporate tax, it's a tax on the workers,” said Kruger, adding “I believe the governor did misjudge this.” The New York City Independent Budget Office said the tolls had been expected to yield $400 million this year and then $1 billion annually. Toll revenues were set to finance $15 billion in capital projects for the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, which runs a vast transportation network in the city and throughout big chunks of the state. The MTA has already allocated more than $400 million for infrastructure to implement congestion pricing, according to the budget office, and has a contract worth more than $500 million with a private vendor tasked with operating and maintaining the tolling infrastructure. Before the abrupt reversal, Hochul had been an avid supporter of congestion pricing and had touted the program as recently as two weeks ago. Heavy pushback began to mount as the start date neared, with harsh criticism coming from the city's suburban commuters.

author: CBS News
title: Store owner and friend save employee from knife-wielding suspect in Revere - CBS Boston
text:
REVERE - A man who allegedly tried to rob a furniture store in Revere was arrested Thursday night after police said the store's owner and his friends subdued him, saving a clerk.
Police said the unidentified man burst into B.D.'s Furniture Outlet armed with a knife and jumped over the counter towards a young woman working there.
"The girl, she was by herself," store owner Thaiar Tuffaha told WBZ-TV. "And with a knife, he threatened her, she's scared away, tried to open the cash register."
Tuffaha said he saw all of this unfold on surveillance video in the back of the store. While the man allegedly tried to grab money from the cash register, Tuffaha and two of his friends ran in and tackled him, holding him down until police arrived.
"It's the first time happening here, of course it's nerve-wracking," said Tuffaha.
One of Tuffaha's friends got slashed in the hand by the would be robber and was taken to the hospital for treatment.
"Thanks God, thanks God. He got hurt, but that's not the way it should be," said Tuffaha. "Hopefully my friend is OK."
The suspect was also taken to the hospital. Police said the robbery is still under investigation.

author: Michael Guta
title: Make Royalty-Free Music With Suno AI for Your Small Business in Minutes
text:
Published: Apr 11, 2024 by Michael Guta In Small Business News 0 Share on Twitter Share on Facebook Share on Flipboard Share on LinkedIn Share on Pinterest Share on BizSugar Licensing music can be expensive, and using copyrighted music without permission can land you in hot water. That’s where Suno AI comes in. Finding the right music is a particularly challenging aspect of content creation. And creating high-quality content that stands out from the crowd can be challenging, especially for small businesses with limited resources. Suno AI is an innovative platform that uses artificial intelligence to generate original music for content creators. With Suno AI, your small business can create high-quality, royalty-free music for its content without needing musical expertise or expensive licensing fees. Here’s how it works: 1. Choose your mood: Suno AI offers a range of mood options, from happy and upbeat to calm and relaxing. Simply select the mood that best fits your content. 2. Customize your music: Suno AI’s intuitive interface allows you to customize your music by adjusting the tempo, key, and instruments. You can even add your own voiceovers or sound effects. 3. Preview and download: Once you’re happy with your music, you can preview it and make any final adjustments. When you’re ready, simply download your music and add it to your content. Suno AI’s music is completely royalty-free, meaning you can use it in your content without worrying about licensing fees or copyright infringement. This makes it an ideal solution for small businesses looking to create high-quality content on a budget. But the benefits of Suno AI don’t stop there. Here are some additional ways small businesses can use Suno AI to enhance their content creation: 1. Create consistent branding: By using the same mood and customizations across all of your content, you can create a consistent brand identity that resonates with your audience. 2. Save time: Creating music from scratch can be time-consuming. With Suno AI, you can create high-quality music in minutes, freeing up more time to focus on other aspects of your content creation. 3. Stand out from the crowd: With so much content being created every day, it can be hard to stand out. Using unique, custom music can help your content stand out and capture your audience’s attention. Suno AI is a powerful tool for small businesses looking to create high-quality, engaging content. With its intuitive interface, customizable music, and royalty-free licensing, Suno AI makes it easy and affordable to create music for content without breaking the bank. So why not give it a try and see how Suno AI can improve your content creation today?

author: ECDC
title: Strengthening Africa CDC Epidemiology Training Programme in Addis Ababa
text:
Strengthening Africa CDC Epidemiology Training Programme in Addis Ababa
Africa CDC has completed the initial classroom phase of its intensive epidemiology training programme in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, with significant support from ECDC. The first phase, which ran from 29 July to 1 November 2024, marked the beginning of a comprehensive two-year-long programme designed to strengthen Africa’s epidemic preparedness by equipping fellows with advanced epidemiology skills.
The African Epidemic Service (AES) programme, established by Africa CDC, has become a cornerstone of the public health workforce development strategy. With three tracks – Epidemiology, Laboratory Leadership, and Public Health Informatics – the AES addresses Africa’s needs in key areas of epidemic response. The recently completed epidemiology track ran with 10 fellows, who will continue hands-on training in various host sites across Africa for the next nine months.
Throughout the programme, ECDC provided essential support in developing the AES curriculum, while also delivering French translations and interpretation services for training materials. ECDC’s contributions enabled knowledge-sharing, creating a rich learning environment for the participants.
The programme’s first phase consisted of a 14-week agenda, which included sessions on topics such as public health, epidemiology, biostatistics, public health surveillance, outbreak investigation, and health economics. The successful completion of the first phase of the epidemiology training marks another step towards strengthening the continent’s capacity to manage infectious disease threats effectively.
Background
The Africa CDC – ECDC Partnership programme is a four-year capacity-building project launched in January 2021 and funded by the European Commission’s DG for International Partnerships. The project is designed to support Africa CDC’s capacity to monitor and respond to health threats across the continent, facilitating harmonised disease surveillance and sharing best practices with the EU in disease intelligence and emergency response.
Africa CDC
Africa CDC strengthens the capacity and capability of Africa’s public health institutions as well as partnerships to detect and respond quickly and effectively to disease threats and outbreaks, based on data-driven interventions and programmes.
[
](/en/about-ecdc/partners-and-networks/international-cooperation/africa-cdc-ecdc-partnership)
Africa CDC – ECDC Partnership
ECDC is collaborating with Africa CDC to strengthen the capacities of Africa CDC in preparedness and response to health threats.

](/en/about-us/who-we-work/international-activities)
International cooperation
ECDC cooperates with international partners, such as the World Health Organization and the centres for disease control and prevention (CDCs) across the globe.
